Platform.Title: UCF BMS M. tuberculosis v1.0
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: The slides are printed on 48 grids wiith each grid containing 15 columns and 15 rows with following pattern; PinX metacol=4, PinY metarow=12, PinX spacing pixels=450, PinY spacing pixels=450, Spot spacing pixels=27, Spot size pixels =~15, Column number=15, Row number=15, 2QMT with arrayer LUCIDEA.
Platform.Description: The genome microarray consists of 4,750 70-mer oligonucleotides representing 4127 ORFs from Mycobacterium tuberculosis - reference strain H37Rv, and 623 unique ORFs from strain CDC1551 which are not present in the H37Rv strain's annotated gene complement. The full 70-mer complement is printed twice on the surface of the microarray. The microarray also contains 500 additional features which have been reserved for future use.

Column.Description: Meta row of slide

Column.Description: Meta column of slide

Column.Name: SubRow
Column.Description: Row of block

Column.Description: Row of cloumn

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Locus primarily hit by the oligo; primary target

Column.Name: GeneSymbol
Column.Description: Gene symbol

Column.Name: CommonName
Column.Description: Primarily annotated function

Column.Name: Strain
Column.Description: Target strain of oligo design

Column.Name: SwissPROT_TrEMBL
Column.Description: SwissProt ID

Column.Name: GenBank_ID
Column.Description: Protein ID

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: Spotted 70-mer oligonucleotide sequence

Column.Name: Well_ID
Column.Description: Oligomer well ID

Platform.Title: UCF BMS M. tuberculosis ver 2.0
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: The slides are printed on 96 grids with each grid containing 23 rows and 10 columns with following pattern; MetaRow=12, MetaColumn=8, Pix X(pix)=225, Pix Y(pix)=450, Row number=23, Column number=10, X Spacing(pix)=17, Y Spacing(pix)=17. 2QMT with arrayer LUCIDEA.
Platform.Description: The genome microarray consists of 4,750 70-mer oligonucleotides representing 3,417 oligonucleotides from M. tuberculosis reference strain H37Rv, and 1,333 oligonucleotides from strain CDC1551. Oligos are designed to provide coverage across the above organisms used in the design. The full 70-mer complement is printed 4 times on the surface of the microarray. The microarray also contains 500 A. thaliana 70-mer oligonucleotides for internal controls.

Column.Name: MetaRow
Column.Description: Meta row of slide

Column.Description: Meta column of slide

Column.Description: Row of block

Column.Description: Column of block

Column.Description: Locus primarily hit by the oligo; primary target

Column.Description: Primarily annotated function

Column.Description: Target strain of oligo design

Column.Description: Spotted 70-mer oligonucleotide sequences

Column.Name: Oligo_ID
Column.Description: Oligo well ID

Sample.Title: F5.D01.v2.110343

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 1 day in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 1 day
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 1 day Replicates; Biological (1/3) - Technical (1/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 1 day Replicates; Biological (2/3) - Technical (1/2), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: F6.D01.v2.105842

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 1 day in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 1 day
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.

Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: F5.D02.v2.110345

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 2 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 2 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 2 days Replicates; Biological (1/3) - Technical (1/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 2 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 2 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 2 days Replicates; Biological (2/3) - Technical (2/2), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 3 days Replicates; Biological (1/5) - Technical (1/3), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 3 days Replicates; Biological (3/5) - Technical (1/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Sample.Title: F5.D03.v2.111481

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3

This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 3 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 3 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 3 days Replicates; Biological (3/5) - Technical (2/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: F7.D03.v2.109810

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 3 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 3 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.

This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 3 days Replicates; Biological (5/5) - Technical (1/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 6 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 6 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3

Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 6 days Replicates; Biological (1/4) - Technical (2/8), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 6 days Replicates; Biological (1/4) - Technical (7/8), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 6 days Replicates; Biological (2/4) - Technical (4/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Sample.Title: F4.D06.v2.110334

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3

This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 6 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 6 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.

This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 6 days Replicates; Biological (3/4) - Technical (1/3), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: F1.D12.v1.12946944

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted in multiple stress medium at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 12 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 12 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 12 days Replicates; Biological (1/2) - Technical (1/7), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown under multiple stress for 12 days in Dubos medium (pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 12 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 12 days Replicates; Biological (1/2) - Technical (6/7), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 0, 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL standard multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. The standard multiple stress medium was prepared by mixing 1X Dubos Broth base and 10% (v/v) albumin supplement at pH5.0, finally comprising 0.75% Dextrose, 0.5% BSA, and 0.85% NaCl in acidic condition. No glycerol was added in the multiple stress medium except 0.02% (v/v) Tween 80. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 12 days Replicates; Biological (2/2) - Technical (4/4), Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: F10.D03.v2.109220

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.

The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.

This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 3 days in reduced DUBOS medium (10%, pH5.0). Replicates 1 of 6, Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 18 days in reduced DUBOS medium (10%, pH5.0). Replicates 5 of 6, Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: F10.D18.v2.109389

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown without multiple stress in normal Dubos medium (pH7.0) with glycerol until OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Reference cells diluted into modified multiple stress medium (10% DUBOS, pH5.0) at day 0.
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Once the seed culture reached the above OD600 (OD600=0.2), part of the cell culture was harvested, and frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80C. The total RNA isolated from each harvest cells served as control in the microarray hybridization.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Wild-type M. tuberculosis H37RV was grown in the complete normal Dubos medium supplemented with 1.5% glycerol at pH7.0. The cells were incubated in vented cap bottles aerobically at 37C until OD600 reached to 0.2. To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown for 18 days under multiple stress in reduced Dubos medium (10%, pH5.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Multiple stressed for 18 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 3, 9, and 18 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL one tenth water dilution of the acidic multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. To achieve more stringent starvation, one tenth water dilution of the acidic multiple stress medium was used with the supplemental surfactant (0.018% (v/v) Tyloxapol) at pH5.0. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. The bottles were sealed with a rubber septum flip top cap, and molten paraffin wax on the outside of the cap to ensure air-tight. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Multiple stress for 18 days in reduced DUBOS medium (10%, pH5.0). Replicates 6 of 6, Grown in rolling bottle, Replacing head space every other day with gas mixture (O2:CO2:N2 = 5:10:85).
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie.
