To synchronize growth before inoculation, cells were diluted in the same medium and grown again until OD600 value of 0.2 before harvest (i.e. seed culture for microarray control sets).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Channel.Source: M. tuberculosis H37Rv grown for 18 days in reduced Dubos medium (10%, pH7.0) without glycerol starting from OD600=0.2.
Channel.Characteristics: Starved for 18 days
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were harvested after 3, 9, and 18 days incubation under the given multiple stresses. After centrifugation, cells were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The seed culture for microarray control sets was collected by centrifugation, and resuspended with 150 mL one tenth water dilution of the multiple stress medium to recover the original OD600 (OD600=0.2) in a 1 liter glass bottle with a 24/40 standard joint neck. To achieve starvation stress only, one tenth water dilution of the multiple stress medium was used with the supplemental surfactant (0.018% (v/v) Tyloxapol) at pH7.0. The head air space in each bottle was replaced every other day for 5 minutes with gas mixture (5% O2, 10% CO2 and 85 % N2) passing through a 0.2 um filter attached to a 18-G needle. Sealed culture bottles were rolled in a roller incubator at 37C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cells were harvested and quickly frozen in a dry ice-ethanol both. Total RNA was isolated using glass beads (Bio101, Lysing Matrix B), a TRIzol (InVitrogen) extraction and purified by Rneasy (Qiagen) kit according to the manufacturers' recommendations.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 10 μg of total RNA and 2 μg of random oligonucleotide hexamers (Invitrogen, CA) were incubated 15 min at 65 °C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.02 mM dUTP, 1.5 nmol aminoallyl-dUTP (Amersham, NJ), and 2 μl Stratascript RTase II (Invitrogen, CA) in a total volume of 30 μl. This mixture was incubated 10 min at room temperature, and 42 °C overnight. Synthesized cDNA was purified by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen, CA) according to the manufacturer’s recommendation. The aminoallyl-dUTP-conjugated cDNA probes was spin-dried (SpeedVac, Savant), resuspended in 50 mM sodium carbonate buffer (pH 9.3) and cyanine monofunctional dyes (Amersham) for 1 h at room temperature followed by quenching with 4 M hydoxylamine. Cyanine-labeled probes were purified again by QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization, blocking and washing was performed following the procedure provided at TIGR, PFGRC; http://pfgrc.jcvi.org/index.php/microarray/protocols.html
Sample.Scan-Protocol: QuantArray (ver. 3.0, Perkin Elmer) was used for 16-bit TIFF image quantification and intial visualization.
Sample.Description: Starvation for 18 days in reduced DUBOS medium (10%, pH7.0). Replicates 5 of 6, Grown in rolling bottle, Normal aeration
Sample.Data-Processing: scal-MAD and ratio-intensity quantile normalization using R (ver. 2.1.1) package (http://www.bioconductor.org) & S-plus ArrayAnalyzer (ver.2.0). Regardless of dyes used in dye-swap cases, signals from reference sample were always denoted as Green during normaliztion. Signals from scratched or bad spots (ie. Intensity - Background <0) were tagged and removed before normalization.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Average scale-pin tip-MAD normalized log2 ratio between Sample and Reference (log2(Sample/Reference)).

Sample.Title: SV.D18.v2.109692

Series.Title: In vitro dormancy achieved by multiple stresses in Mycobacterium tuberculosis
Series.Summary: The human pathogen, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, develops a dormant infection, in which organisms survive within the body. We established a unique in vitro dormancy model based on the characterization of drug-resistance to INH and rifampin. M. tuberculosis cells were maintained in controlled and defined multiple stress conditions with low oxygen (5% dissolved oxygen tension), acid (pH 5.) along with glycerol-deprived medium conditions. To monitor gene expression changes in M. tuberculosis in response to the multiple stresses, we performed microarray analysis at the time point of 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12days after treatment. M. tuberculosis adapting to multiple stresses displayed characteristics associated with persistence in vivo, including entry into a non-replicative state and the repression of genes involved in energy regeneration. Under in vitro multiple-stresses, M. tuberculosis significantly modulated gene expression mainly in response to the starvation stresses. Cells exposed to these multiple stress conditions shows significant drug-resistance. Comparison with other in vivo expression profiles demonstrates induction of several common genes for in vitro dormancy conditions. Keywords: Stress response in time course.
Series.Overall-Design: Samples under multiple stress condition were taken at day 1, 2, 3, 6, and 12 for microarray hybridization. More than two technical replicates per biological samples with Cy3/5 dye-swaps.
